intro: Bufonia paniculata subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental panicled bufonia, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
